title: Creating a reading list of articles on opinion mining in the context of natural language processing (NLP), with a focus on the analysis of arguments from a social science perspective, involves selecting a mix of foundational and recent works
note: Here’s a curated list of 20 articles that cover these topics up to 2023:

title: Opinion mining and sentiment analysis
container-title: *Foundations and Trends in Information Retrieval*. This foundational paper provides a comprehensive overview of sentiment analysis techniques

title: Sentiment analysis and opinion mining
container-title: *Synthesis Lectures on Human Language Technologies*. A detailed introduction to the field of opinion mining

title: New avenues in opinion mining and sentiment analysis
container-title: *IEEE Intelligent Systems*. Discusses emerging trends in sentiment analysis

title: Techniques and applications for sentiment analysis
container-title: *Communications of the ACM*. Reviews various techniques used in sentiment analysis

title: Comparative experiments using supervised learning and machine translation for multilingual sentiment analysis
container-title: *Computer Speech & Language*. Explores multilingual sentiment analysis

title: Fracking sarcasm using neural network
container-title: *Proceedings of the 7th Workshop on Computational Approaches to Subjectivity, Sentiment and Social Media Analysis*. Focuses on detecting sarcasm in sentiment analysis

title: A survey on opinion mining and sentiment analysis: Tasks, approaches and applications
container-title: *Knowledge-Based Systems*. Provides a survey of tasks and approaches in opinion mining

title: Deep learning for sentiment analysis: A survey
container-title: *Wiley Interdisciplinary Reviews: Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery*. Discusses the application of deep learning in sentiment analysis

title: Hello, it’s GPT-2—how can I help you? Towards the use of pretrained language models for task-oriented dialogue systems
container-title: *Proceedings of the 3rd Workshop on Neural Generation and Translation*. Explores the use of language models in dialogue systems

title: Parsing argumentation structures in persuasive essays
container-title: *Computational Linguistics*. Analyzes argumentation structures, bridging NLP and social sciences

title: Argumentation mining in user-generated web discourse
container-title: *Computational Linguistics*. Focuses on mining arguments from web discourse

title: Argument mining: A survey
container-title: *Computational Linguistics*. Provides a comprehensive survey of argument mining techniques

title: Five years of argument mining: A data-driven analysis
container-title: *Proceedings of the Twenty-Seventh International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence*. Reviews progress in argument mining

title: Tweeties squabbling: Positive and negative results in applying argument mining on social media
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2017 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing*. Examines argument mining on social media platforms

title: Cross-domain mining of argumentative text through distant supervision
container-title: *Proceedings of the 15th Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies*. Discusses cross-domain argument mining

title: Argument mining from heterogeneous sources: A survey and challenges
container-title: *Artificial Intelligence Review*. Surveys argument mining across different sources

title: Argument mining from speech: Detecting claims in political debates
container-title: *Proceedings of the Thirtieth AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence*. Focuses on argument mining in political debates

title: Computational argumentation quality assessment in natural language
container-title: *Proceedings of the 15th Conference of the European Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics*. Discusses assessing the quality of arguments

title: Identifying argumentation schemes in genetics research articles
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2nd Workshop on Argumentation Mining*. Applies argument mining to scientific texts

title: What is the essence of a claim? Cross-domain claim identification
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2017 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing*. Explores claim identification across domains

title: These articles provide a broad overview of opinion mining and argument analysis, integrating perspectives from both NLP and social sciences
